messages: 644e468d7f69da5d892cea0f6dcadebe (13:39): keep in mind that each storage engine implements indexes in slightly different ways.

644e468d7f69da5d892cea0f6dcadebe (13:40): PaulZ123: for a good general definition of KEY/Index look here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Index_%28database%29
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:42): TodoInTX: I ask other question: is KEY = PRIMARY KEY or FOREIGN KEY?
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:44): CREATE TABLE access ( first int(5) NOT NULL, status varchar(5) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (first));
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:44): CREATE TABLE test ( uid int(5) NOT NULL default '0', access int(10) NOT NULL default '0', PRIMARY KEY (uid), KEY access (access));

644e468d7f69da5d892cea0f6dcadebe (13:44): no, key is just an index on it's own.  Primary key is unique and key.  Foreign key makes a reference to another table to ensure that parent rows are always present.
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:44): TodoInTX: can you help me say?
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:45): ok, I understand it, that KEY is uniqal and first parameter is name KEY, second in () is name column - yes ?
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:46): but why doesn't exist definition of KEY? :)
644e468d7f69da5d892cea0f6dcadebe (13:46): those create table statements look proper.  I'm not sure what you are asking.
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:47): why it doesn't exist in documentation? I want see it in documentation definition of KEY statement.
644e468d7f69da5d892cea0f6dcadebe (13:48): http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/create-index.html is same thing as CREATE KEY
899ad75d04b84280a3a34aa35fe864d5 (13:50): TodoInTX: thx for help, I was confused ;)
